title: Training on Structured Tools for Project Review Processes and Organizational Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Project Management Concepts and Elementary-Level Language Proficiency
context.additional_context: Educational course for current practitioners to systematically learn lessons from project reviews and strengthen tool-development capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the four components (planning, execution, evaluation, improvement) of the project review process in simulation environments.
Structured survey instruments can be used to quantify and analyze lessons learned from project reviews
Learners can demonstrate the process of establishing and sharing organizational learning strategies with peer practitioners in a VR-based collaborative environment
The impact of project scale (personnel/budget) and career level on the review process can be comparatively analyzed through case studies
Learners can apply learned content to create virtual project review reports through summative assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
